sen.j: 松原通（まつばらどおり）は京都市の東西の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Matsubara-dori Street is one of the major east-west running streets of Kyoto City.
Matsubara-dori Street is one of the major east-west streets in Kyoto City.
Matsubara-dori Street is one of the major east-west streets in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 東は清水寺門前から、西は佐井西通の一筋西まで。
sen.e: It starts in front of the gate of Kiyomizu-dera Temple and goes to a block west of Sainishi-dori Street.
It starts in front of the gate of Kiyomizu-dera Temple and goes to a block west of Sainishi-dori Street.
It starts in front of the gate of Kiyomizu-dera Temple and extends a block beyond Sainishi-dori Street in the west.
sen.cmt: in the westを追加しました。

sen.j: 東の端、清水寺門前から東大路通までは清水道ともよばれる。
sen.e: From the east end, the gate of Kiyomizu-dera Temple, to the Kiyomizu-michi is also called Kiyomizu-michi.
From the east end (the gate of Kiyomizu-dera Temple) to the Kiyomizu-michi is also called Kiyomizu-michi.
From the east end (which is the gate of Kiyomizu-dera Temple) to the Higashioji-dori Street is also called Kiyomizu-michi.
sen.cmt: 道路名を修正しました。

sen.j: 寺町通から西は平安京の五条大路にあたる。
sen.e: The street west of the Teramachi-dori Street corresponds to the Gojo-oji Street of Heiankyo.
The street west of Teramachi-dori Street corresponds to Gojo-oji Street of Heiankyo.
The street west of Teramachi-dori Street corresponds to Gojo-oji Street of Heian-kyo.

sen.j: 松並木の綺麗な通から「五条松原通」と言われるようになり、後に「松原通」の名前だけが残った。
sen.e: Beautiful pine trees bordering the street made the street called "Gojo-Matsubara dori Street," and only the name "Matsubara dori Street" have remained.
The beautiful pine trees bordering the street led it to be called "Gojo-Matsubara dori Street," but only the name "Matsubara dori Street" has remained.
The beautiful pine trees bordering the street led it to be called 'Gojo-Matsubara-dori Street,' but only the name 'Matsubara-dori Street' remains.

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉が五条の橋を現在の地に架けたことから二筋南に五条通の名前が移った。
sen.e: Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI moved a bridge in Gojo to where it is today, and the street 2 block south having the Gojo-no-hashi took over the name of Gojo-dori Street.
Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI moved a bridge in Gojo to where it is today, and the street two blocks south (having the name Gojo-no-hashi) then assumed the name of Gojo-dori Street.
Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI moved a bridge in Gojo to where it is today, and the street two blocks south (having the name Gojo-no-hashi Bridge) then assumed the name of Gojo-dori Street.

sen.j: つまり、牛若丸と武蔵坊弁慶が出会ったと言われる「五条の橋」は、松原通に架かる橋が正当であり、現在五条大橋西詰におかれている2人の像は二筋南におかれていることになる。
sen.e: Therefore the bridge of the Matsubara-dori Street is the true "bridge in Gojo" where Ushiwakamaru and Musasibo Benkei Priest are said to have met; this means that the statues of Ushiwakamaru and Benkei standing at Gojo-ohashi Nishizum is placed 2 blocks south of where they should be.

Therefore, the bridge of the Matsubara-dori Street is the true "bridge in Gojo" where Ushiwakamaru and the priest Musasibo Benkei are said to have met; this means that the statues of Ushiwakamaru and Benkei standing at Gojo-ohashi Nishizum are placed two blocks south of where they should be.

Therefore, the bridge of the Matsubara-dori Street is the true 'bridge in Gojo' where Ushiwakamaru and the priest Musashibo Benkei are said to have met; this means that the statues of Ushiwakamaru and Benkei standing at Gojo-ohashi Nishizume are two blocks south of where they should be.
sen.cmt: 名前、地名などスペルを修正しました。

sen.j: その橋も、鴨川 (淀川水系)であるとする説の他、鴨川には橋は架かっておらず五条天神宮の近く、西洞院通に沿って流れていた川に架かっていた橋であるとする説もある。
sen.e: Nevertheless, some say that the bridge where they met is not the bridge over the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa water system) but is the bridge near Gojo Tenshingu Shrine that crossed a river running along the Nishinotoin-dori Street.

Nevertheless, some say that the bridge where they met is not the bridge over the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa water system) but is the bridge near Gojo Tenshingu Shrine that crossed a river running along Nishinotoin-dori Street.

Incidentally, some say that the bridge where they met was the one spanning over the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River system), while others say the bridge was the one near Gojo Tenshingu Shrine that crossed a river running along Nishinotoin-dori Street, since Kamo-gawa had no bridge.
sen.cmt: 原文どおりに修正しました。

sen.j: 現在は多くの区間が一方通行の細い道で、堀川通をはさんで商店街が続く。
sen.e: The most of Matsubara-dori Street today is a narrow one-way street in the shopping district that continues across the Horikawa-dori Street.
Most of Matsubara-dori Street today is a narrow, one-way road in the shopping district that continues across Horikawa-dori Street.
Most of Matsubara-dori Street today is a narrow, one-way road in the shopping district that continues across Horikawa-dori Street.

sen.j: 三条・四条・五条・七条といった大通り以外で、車で、烏丸通から東大路通まで通り抜けることのできる唯一の通りである（逆方向は不可）。
sen.e: This street is the only street except main thoroughfares such as Sanjo, Shijo, Gojo, Shichijo that takes you from the Karasuma-dori Street to the Higashioji-dori Street by car (not in the opposite direction).

This street is the only one (except for main thoroughfares such as Sanjo, Shijo, Gojo and Shichijo) that can take you from Karasuma-dori Street to Higashioji-dori Street by car (not in the opposite direction).

This street is the only one (except for main thoroughfares such as Sanjo, Shijo, Gojo and Shichijo) that can take you from Karasuma-dori Street to Higashioji-dori Street by car (not in the opposite direction).
